title: HydraStart: Simple and Fast Hydra Setup and Testing
summary: There is significant setup and work to create and test multi-user Hydra heads.
solution: Build an easy-to-understand Hydra user interface tool that allows any developer to quickly set up, create and integrate their logic, and test their use case
proposer_relevant_experience:
This project will be delivered by a single team member with over two years of experience as a Cardano developer building products and creating demonstration videos in the ecosystem.

**Team Member:** Joshua Kuski, [https://x\.com/ThaMacroMan](https://x.com/ThaMacroMan)

Role: Project Lead, Backend, Frontend, QA, and video demonstrator

Responsibilities: System architecture, backend development, frontend development (Next.js, Typescript, Cardano node, Hydra node), quality assurance, documentation, and video demonstration

fields.title: Campaign Category

sub_fields.title: Category Questions
sub_fields.description: Answer the following questions to determine the eligibility of your proposal.

sub_fields.title: Describe what makes your idea innovative compared to what has been previously launched in the market (whether by you or others).
sub_fields.description: Please provide your rationale.
sub_fields.answer:
Previously funded Hydra proposals include: Hydra SDK – Fast, Modular, WASM Cardano Toolkit, Hydra Hexcore, Hydra Hexcore – Tool for Deployment Multi-Hydra Party,  Hydra Hub – SaaS Node Distribution System Phase 1, and cPoker Hydra Case Study: Implement Interactive dApp.

These projects are great for full implementation, but developers lack a quick, easy to use, end-to-end Hydra testing mechanism to set up, learn, test, and validate how Hydra can be used for their use-case in a local testnet environment.

With HydraStart, we will simplify Hydra setup, wallet management, and use case logic setup with a simple interactive user interface and example logic  templates and demonstrations.

sub_fields.title: Describe what your prototype or MVP will demonstrate, and where it can be accessed.
sub_fields.description: Please provide your rationale.
sub_fields.answer:
HydraStart MVP will demonstrate:

1. A friendly user interface for developers of any skill level to setup a multi-user Hydra head
2. User interface testing and transaction visibility and metrics
3. Logic templates for testing hydra programmatically with accompanied user-interface for full hydra demo

The repo will be open sourced and publicly accessible for the benefit of the Cardano ecosystem, alongside X and Youtube cross-posted content discussing and demoing the HydraStart.

sub_fields.title: Describe realistic measures of success, ideally with on-chain metrics.
sub_fields.description: Please provide your rationale.
sub_fields.answer:
1. Hydra becomes more approachable for junior developers 
2. 30 minutes or less from Hydra setup to testing transactions with real use case logic
3. Increase social discussion and developer usage of Hydra, increasing adoption of Cardano and Hydra for real-world use cases.

sub_fields.title: Please describe your proposed solution and how it addresses the problem
sub_fields.description: Please describe your proposed solution and how it addresses the problem
sub_fields.answer:
HydraStart will simplify:

1. Cardano node and Hydra node setup
2. Cardano and Hydra wallet creation, funding, and UTXO Management
3. One-Click Multi-user Hydra node start and stop, with accessible Hydra node script and logging commands
4. Initialization, committing, and transacting in the Hydra head with visible transaction metrics and data
5. Logic templates that drive Hydra transactions and metadata for real-world use case testing and analysis

Overall, it will simplify the process for developers to learn, build, and test with Hydra. I've already begun building the start of this implementation with a demo here: [https://x\.com/ThaMacroMan/status/1991365496743293387?s=20](https://x.com/ThaMacroMan/status/1991365496743293387?s=20)

sub_fields.title: Please define the positive impact your project will have on the wider Cardano community
sub_fields.description: Please define the positive impact your project will have on the wider Cardano community
sub_fields.answer:
HydraStart will transform the Hydra development experience by dramatically lowering the technical barrier to entry. Developers of all skill and experience will be able to spin up local testnet Hydra heads, simulate real-world interactions, and visualize transaction flows in under 30 minutes.

By offering a friendly user interface, ready-made logic templates, and clear transaction metrics, HydraStart empowers:

New builders to explore Hydra without wrestling with complex nodes, commands, or CLI

dApp developers to validate real-time use cases like group payments, rewards, and matches

This tool fills the current gap between protocol-level Hydra tooling and actual application experimentation. It will serve as a gateway for future builders and projects to apply and adopt Cardano and Hydra.

sub_fields.title: What is your capability to deliver your project with high levels of trust and accountability? How do you intend to validate if your approach is feasible?
sub_fields.description: What is your capability to deliver your project with high levels of trust and accountability? How do you intend to validate if your approach is feasible?
sub_fields.answer:
I am a full-time Cardano developer, and have been building on Cardano for over two years while being an active community member for over 5 years.

Recently, I have been building and making videos working on Masumi Agents, Chakra Agents, and now working with Hydra. Feasibility has already begun to be validated with my work on my open sourced HydraFactory [https://x\.com/ThaMacroMan/status/1991365496743293387?s=20](https://x.com/ThaMacroMan/status/1991365496743293387?s=20.)

I have proven I can reach the community with unique tools and useful walkthroughs and demos of what I have been building. More examples:

[https://x\.com/ThaMacroMan/status/1978948318232248429?s=20](https://x.com/ThaMacroMan/status/1978948318232248429?s=20)

[https://x\.com/ThaMacroMan/status/1970559882630963501?s=20](https://x.com/ThaMacroMan/status/1970559882630963501?s=20)

sub_fields.title: Milestone Title
sub_fields.description: A clear, concise title for this milestone
sub_fields.answer: End-to-end multi-user Hydra setup

sub_fields.title: Milestone Outputs
sub_fields.description: What will be delivered in this milestone
sub_fields.answer:
A simple UI that encompasses: 

1. Cardano node setup and management
2. Hydra node setup
3. Wallet creation, funding, and management flow
4. Hydra node startup with scripts transparency
5. Full lifecycle and testing UI

sub_fields.title: Acceptance Criteria
sub_fields.description: Specific conditions that must be met
sub_fields.answer:
1. Step by step setup of cardano node, UI for starting and stopping the node
2. Step by step setup of Hydra node
3. One-click wallet generation of Cardano and Hydra wallets, fast funding and UTXO management in the UI
4. UI selection of Hydra wallets and one-click start up of multi-user Hydra head
5. One-Click initialization, UTXO committing, Hydra transactions, and transaction transparency and metrics in the UI

sub_fields.title: Evidence of Completion
sub_fields.description: How you will demonstrate achievement
sub_fields.answer: A demo video showing the application running and using the interface to do an End-to-end setup, Hydra head setup, and testing Hydra transactions with metrics and transaction data visible.

sub_fields.title: Milestone Title
sub_fields.description: A clear, concise title for this milestone
sub_fields.answer: Logic templates and UI buildout

sub_fields.title: Milestone Outputs
sub_fields.description: What will be delivered in this milestone
sub_fields.answer:
1. Multiple logic templates that drive Hydra transactions for different use cases
2. User interface for interaction with logic templates
3. Logic integration with Hydra including metrics and transaction data

sub_fields.title: Acceptance Criteria
sub_fields.description: Specific conditions that must be met
sub_fields.answer:
1. Three different use-case logic templates that take user inputted data to drive the Hydra transactions
2. Each logic template can be selected from and show user input fields in the UI. Entries create Hydra transactions between the hydra nodes. 
3. Each template tracks transaction metrics (transaction speed and transaction count) and show each transaction and its metadata in real time in the UI

sub_fields.title: Evidence of Completion
sub_fields.description: How you will demonstrate achievement
sub_fields.answer:
1. Each template has its own specific user interface setup based on the use case and data required
2. Hydra transactions are performed using each template, tracking the transaction speed, count, and showing the transactions and metadata.
3. Transactions and metadata match Hydra state

2. Clear, to the point documentation and links to find Hydra documentation,  contact myself, and contact other Hydra developers and communities.
3. HydraStart is open sourced under MIT License with all logic templates and documentation.
4. Multiple demo videos with approachable language and content length (short, simple and longer, more detailed videos)

sub_fields.title: Please provide a cost breakdown of the proposed work and resources
sub_fields.description: Please provide a cost breakdown of the proposed work and resources
sub_fields.answer:
Milestone 1: End-to-end multi-user Hydra setup

- Building off already started HydraFactory
- 1 FTE, for 1.5 weeks
- Budget: 5000 ADA

Milestone 2: Logic templates and UI buildout

- 1 FTE, for 1 month
- Budget: 15,000 ADA

Milestone 3: User flow and backend polishing, documentation, open source, and demo videos

- 1 FTE for 1 month
- Budget: 15,000 ADA

sub_fields.title: How does the cost of the project represent value for the Cardano ecosystem?
sub_fields.description: How does the cost of the project represent value for the Cardano ecosystem?
sub_fields.answer:
HydraStart will create value for the ecosystem by significantly reducing the barrier to entry for all levels of developers to begin building with Hydra for their use case.

It will help onboard new developers to build new use cases with Hydra, skipping the difficult initial setup and script management encountered by developers today.

As the project covers Mac, Windows, and Linux systems while simultaneously lowering the barrier to entry, HydraStart will kickstart new development of use cases that require instant finality and data availability, including sports and gaming.
